concept_data.title: European Semester for economic policy coordination

summary: The "European Semester" is a pivotal framework for economic policy coordination within the European Union, facilitating the alignment of national fiscal policies with EU objectives. This regulatory mechanism ensures that member states adhere to the Stability and Growth Pact, promoting fiscal discipline and macroeconomic stability. Through a structured cycle of assessments and recommendations, the European Semester enables the European Commission to monitor economic developments and provide guidance on structural reforms. As a redirect to the preferred term "European Semester," it underscores the importance of this process in enhancing economic governance and fostering convergence among EU economies.
